--- title: "3.3 — Capital & Interest Theory — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Dates *Thursday, October 27, 2022* ::: ::: {.callout-warning appearance="minimal"} # Assignments Due Your [1st short paper](assignments/01-short-paper) on the Classical Era is due Friday October 28 by email. ::: ## Overview Today we continue the marginalist revolution. ## Readings ### Required Readings - Skim Irving Fisher, Eugen von Böhm-Bawerk, (optional: Wicksell) and their readings in *Reader* - Finish Ch.9 "The Transition to Neoclassical Economics: Marginal Analysis Extended" in Landreth & Colander - Ch.11 "Marginal productivity and factor prices" in Blaug ### Recommended Readings: - [ Knight, Frank, 1921, *Risk, Uncertainty, and Profit*](https://www.econlib.org/library/Knight/knRUP.html) The following Wikipedia entries can also provide more background: - [ Eugen von Böhm-Bawerk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugen_von_Böhm-Bawerk) - [ Frank Knight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Knight) - [ Irving Fisher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irving_Fisher) - [ Fisher hypothesis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisher_hypothesis) - [ Intertemporal choice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intertemporal_choice) - [ Interest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interest) - [ Interest rate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interest_rate) - [ Quantity Theory of Money](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantity_theory_of_money#Fisher's_equation_of_exchange) - [ Knut Wicksell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knut_Wicksell) - [ Cumulative process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cumulative_process) ### Questions to Help Your Reading #### On Profit and Uncertainty - Is entrepreneurship a fourth factor of production that is paid its marginal product? - In what way is pure profit a “residual”? - What is the difference between “risk” and “uncertainty” according to Knight? - How is profit related to uncertainty? - What are the main differences between the *theory* of (perfect) competition, and *actual* competition in the real world? How is this tied in with uncertainty, and with profit? #### On Interest - What are Böhm-Bawerk’s three reasons for a positive rate of interest? - What is “roundaboutness” in production? Why is it more productive, according to Böhm-Bawerk? - What is “time preference”? - How does Fisher conceive of interest as it relates to income, and capitalized values? - What is the quantity theory of money, and Fisher’s equation of exchange? What are the main takeaways? - What is the difference between the “natural rate” and the “market rate” of interest, according to Wicksell? Explain Wicksell’s “cumulative process” that results if the two are different. ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!
